summary: This is a transcript of a DOJ OIG interview with a former SigNet employee regarding technical support provided to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York for a video system server failure around the time of Jeffrey Epstein's death. The interview focuses on the timeline of the server failure, attempts to rebuild it, and potential data loss.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The investigation is into his death and surrounding circumstances at the MCC. He is the subject of the broader OIG investigation.

persons.name: Senior Special Agent
persons.context: Conducting the OIG interview regarding the investigation into Epstein's death. Identifies himself at the start and is present throughout.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: Primary interviewer asking questions about the SigNet service request and technical details of the MCC video system failure.

persons.name: Former SigNet Employee
persons.role: Witness / Former Senior Customer Support Representative
persons.context: The interviewee, a former SigNet employee who provided technical support to the Federal Bureau of Prisons, including the MCC. He details his involvement with a server failure ticket from August 2019.

connections.description: The interviewee's technical work at the MCC coincided with the time of Epstein's death and the subsequent investigation into the facility's video system.
The Special Agent is conducting the official OIG interview of the former SigNet employee as part of the investigation.
Both are DOJ OIG agents working together on the investigation and co-present for the interview.

events.title: MCC Video Server Failure Reported
events.description: A SigNet service request (24975) is created for the MCC after a RAID array crashed. The MCC contact reported the issue.

events.title: Attempted Drive Rebuild and FBI Seizure
events.description: The MCC contact gained access to the DVR room and attempted to replace and rebuild the failed drives. The FBI arrived on site and confiscated the entire video recording system while the rebuild was in process.

events.title: Potential Initial Drive Failure
events.description: The interview discusses the possibility that one of the server drives may have initially failed on this date, which could have started the chain of events leading to the complete system failure.

events.title: DOJ OIG Interview Conducted
events.description: The Office of the Inspector General conducts a telephonic, recorded interview with a former SigNet employee as part of its investigation into Epstein's death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, New York
Agoura Hills, CA 91301 (Location of Resolute Documentation Services)
keyFacts: The interview focuses on a SigNet service request from August 8-10, 2019, for a failed video system RAID array at the MCC, where Jeffrey Epstein died.
The former SigNet employee states the FBI confiscated the video recording equipment on August 10th while drives were being rebuilt, which could have corrupted any remaining video data.
Technical discussion indicates that if two drives in a RAID 5 array failed (as was the case), all data would be lost and the array would need to be completely rebuilt.
The interviewee suggests the MCC contact was following SigNet's instructions for the rebuild and implies the FBI's seizure during the process may have contributed to data loss.

The document is part of the DOJ OIG's investigation into the circumstances surrounding Epstein's death, specifically examining potential evidence preservation issues with the MCC's video surveillance system.
